Class CommandWebConsole.PageParameterAwareMountedMapper

                  net.metarelate.terminology.webedit.CommandWebConsole.PageParameterAwareMountedMapper
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.wicket.request.IRequestMapper
Enclosing class:
CommandWebConsole
public class CommandWebConsole.PageParameterAwareMountedMapper
extends org.apache.wicket.core.request.mapper.MountedMapper

This mapper represents exactly the same behavior like the default MountedMapper, except one behavior:
The default MountedMapper implementation prefers the pageId parameter with a higher priority then the rest of the PageParameters.
This preference leads to the following behavior: 

 ...myApplication/User/4?15
leads to the UserPage with the indexed PageParameters "4" at index 0. So the User with id 4 is shown. When a user manually changes the URL to something like this: 
 ...myApplication/User/5?15
The MountedMapper would deliver the same page as before and would show the user with id 4 and not - like it is implicated in the url - the user with id 5, because the pageId parameter is preferred during mapping process.

Therefore this implementation compares the existing PageParameters of the cached page and the PageParameters of the current request. If a difference between this two PageParameters are recognized, this mapper redirects to a fresh bookmarkable instance of the current requested page.

To use this mapper to mount your pages, you must declare the mapper programmatically in your Application by overwriting the "public void init()" method, like shown below: 







Author:

  
Johannes Unterstein
